messages: 65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (04:19): hi steve

aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (04:33): i wonder if i can just edit the xml in /etc/zones :)
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (04:33): I believe you can, but shouldn't.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (04:33): but I could just as easily be wrong.
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (04:33): I edit the xml files all the time :)
aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (04:34): i suppose it's worth a try
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (04:34): much easier to edit stuff with vim than to use zonecfg
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (04:34): much less supported, too.
